summary: Gin is a type of alcohol that tastes like juniper berries and other plants. It started as medicine made by monks and alchemists in Europe. The Dutch and Belgians made it popular as a drink, and it became really popular in England after 1688 when they had trouble importing other alcohols. Gin is made in many different ways and can have lots of different flavors. People often mix it with tonic water to make a "gin and tonic."
title: Gin
